# NSApplication.PresentationOptions

**Structure**

Constants that control the presentation of the app, typically for fullscreen apps such as games or kiosks.

## Declaration

```swift
struct PresentationOptions
```

## Overview

There are restrictions on the combination of presentation options that can be set simultaneously:

- [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideDock] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/hideDock] are mutually exclusive: You may specify one or the other, but not both.
- [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideMenuBar] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/hideMenuBar] are mutually exclusive: You may specify one or the other, but not both.
- If you specify [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/hideMenuBar], it must be accompanied by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/hideDock].
- If you specify [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideMenuBar], it must be accompanied by either [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/hideDock] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideDock].
- If you specify any of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/disableProcessSwitching], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/disableForceQuit], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/disableSessionTermination], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/disableMenuBarTransparency], it must be accompanied by either [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/hideDock] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideDock].
- [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideToolbar] may be used only when both [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/fullScreen] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/PresentationOptions-swift.struct/autoHideMenuBar] are also set.

When [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication] receives a parameter value that does not conform to these requirements, it raises an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSExceptionName/invalidArgumentException].

## Presentation Options

- **autoHideDock**: The dock is normally hidden, but automatically appears when moused near.
- **hideDock**: The dock is entirely hidden and disabled.
- **autoHideMenuBar**: The menu bar is normally hidden, but automatically appears when moused near.
- **hideMenuBar**: The menu bar is entirely hidden and disabled.
- **disableAppleMenu**: All Apple Menu items are disabled.
- **disableProcessSwitching**: The process switching user interface (Command + Tab to cycle through apps) is disabled.
- **disableForceQuit**: The force quit panel (displayed by pressing Command + Option + Esc) is disabled
- **disableSessionTermination**: The panel that shows the Restart, Shut Down, and Log Out options that are displayed as a result of pushing the power key is disabled.
- **disableHideApplication**: The app’s “Hide” menu item is disabled.
- **disableMenuBarTransparency**: The menu bar transparency appearance is disabled.
- **fullScreen**: The app is in fullscreen mode.
- **autoHideToolbar**: When in fullscreen mode the window toolbar is detached from window and hides and shows with autoHidden menuBar.
- **disableCursorLocationAssistance**: The behavior that allows the user to shake the mouse to locate the cursor is disabled.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**: Initializes a new presentation options structure.

## Managing the app’s appearance

- **appearance**: The appearance associated with the app’s windows.
- **effectiveAppearance**: The appearance that AppKit uses to draw the app’s interface.
- **currentSystemPresentationOptions**: The set of app presentation options that are currently in effect for the system.
- **presentationOptions**: The presentation options that should be in effect for the system when this app is active.
- **applicationShouldSuppressHighDynamicRangeContent**: A boolean value indicating whether your application should suppress HDR content based on established policy. Built-in AppKit components such as NSImageView will automatically behave correctly with HDR content. You should use this value in conjunction with notifications (`NSApplicationShouldBeginSuppressingHighDynamicRangeContentNotification` and `NSApplicationShouldEndSuppressingHighDynamicRangeContentNotification`) to suppress HDR content in your application when signaled to do so.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
